Honest review: didnt like it nothing blew me away. The sushi is pretty plain nothing that u cant get somewhere else for being revered  as the best sushi at least do things different and atleast deliver that promise for being the best the service was okay nothing special didnt give good recommendations didnt describe all the food n took away utencils and didnt give new ones took away the hotsauce that they charged for when we still eating n the wasabi i paid for n like we were done eating and waited forever to order dessert
the only thing i thought was worth ordering again was the Hotate and the Brown butter piroquettes theres alot better places that are cheaper n tastier u dont need to spend a fortune for basic food my favorite sushi place is still kaizan

Mentaiko Spaghetti 15$ didnt like it not as good as mott street. this needed texture really badly and needed something to make it more decadent and needed more of a pop was very bland

Aji yakusugi 12$ (Smoked fish) meh good but thought it was gonna be different the smoke just added smell didnt add any flavor to it

Curry Udon 19$ (be warned its supper hot when it comes to the table give it a minute to cool down) good but curry was not home made which is disappointing since this restaurant is so expensive. theres pork in here with shisto peppers and theres like a cabbage salad on top. My favorite part is the shisto peppers cause it adds heat n mixed with the curry sauce makes it taste so good just no knife so hard to cut it the salad added some sweetness to it which was good i would order this again jus make the curry from scratch put more shisto peppers n more salad on it

Hotate $18 really tasty i love raw scallops there great texturally and have a great sweetness to them its a good dish but is very one dimensional all the components are sour so it goes well with the sweet scallops however this dish needs some heat to counter act that and something salty too n this dish needs texture badly

Live dungeness rice $28 good but needed more uni. The risotto texture was perfect supper creamy without being mushy. The crab adds a wonderful sweet component and the veggies add freshness theres like one uni on top which adds saltyness and brinyness i added wasabi and hotsauce and soysauce to make it taste better so it was lacking complexity  

Ogo $6 (seaweed salad)
I was surprised but this was really good. The seaweed has a nice briny salty taste to it and the dressing is sweet and acidic to cut through the brinyness my only complaint add some heat and texture to it

Cedar roasted kurodai (seabream) $30 good but i had better fish in my life. The skin was crispy however the way it was put on the plate the skin on the other side got soggy. The fish itself didnt have a grilled flavor or was that flavorful was pretty bland and was overcooked i loved the sauce it tasted like mint was really refreshing just was expecting more since it was 30 bucks no complexity

Brown butter piroquettes 11$ best dessert of the nite. there kind of like cookies but not exactly i loved that there savory just wish there was more of them and they were small cause there supper crunchy so kinda hard to eat the white chocolate cream adds great sweetness and theres a bunch of acidic components to cut through the sweetness

Black currant mochi 10$ picture like a pb and j only thing its a kinda basic dessert n the mochi part was unappetizing cause texturally it was supper hard and leathery like fruit roll up

review.des: I had dinner here last night with one of my friends and not only was the food delicious but the service was also exceptional. My friend doesn't eat seafood so our waiter was great as explaining what non-seafood dishes to order. His suggestions were amazing. We ordered the miso soup, miso yasai, cahan, and I ordered the tuna sashimi. We also ordered the udon noodles but had to cancel the order being that we were so full from our other dishes. I will definitely go back to try more things!

Momotaro made my partner's 30th birthday truly special. Not only did our server greet us with a "Happy Birthday!" (he was surprised they knew), they topped off the evening with a complimentary birthday dessert - candle and all.

The atmosphere and decor is very minimal and romantic. The food was delicious, creative, and beautifully set. The service was bar none. I wish I remembered our server's name to give her a shout out, she deserves one. Kind and attentive. The gentleman that brought our food out was also very pleasant, he made us laugh.

All in all, it was a wonderful experience. We will be back. Thank you!
My friend took me to here & I'm so glad she did!! Momomaki roll is amazing, a must order. Also, don't leave without trying the Chili Mentaiko Spaghetti!!!
Everything was great here. Sushi was executed perfectly and fish selection is fresh. Has a great vibe and atmosphere. Highly recommend.
Great sushi and cooked options.  Everything was delicious.  We had a delay getting seated and they gave us a few complimentary appetizers.

My favorite sushi place ever (even beats the fresh sushi out in Hawaii).  They have their fish flown in daily so it's still fresh (and makes for a pricey meal).

I love this place so much.  The food and drinks are all so creative and amazing.

My favorite thing to order here is the otoro sashimi.  All the sashimi just literally melts in your mouth.  One time I was here and they had a special which was otoro tartar...so good.
I've tried some of the skewers- the hatsu (chicken heart), shortrib meatballs, and washugyu. The shortrib was my favorite of the skewers.
I've tried both the curry udon and the spaghetti.  The udon was a larger order than I imagined.  It came out piping hot.  Both noodle dishes were good.  I'd be ok ordering more nigiri and skipping the noodles in the future though.
On to the nigirizushi....I've had the aburi beni toro, Hokkaido hotate, and I think the aji yakusugi.  The first two stood out in my mind.  I remember wanting to order more.
The momomaki is the only maki I've tried.  I prefer sticking with the sashimi or nigiri over the rolls here.

As for drinks...I've had the monk's journey only.  I want to try the other drinks but somehow I keep going back to the same drink.

Service is always great.  The atmosphere is more romantic.  It's dimly lit inside.  I've always made my reservations on OpenTable about a week ahead of time and haven't had too much trouble getting the time slot I wanted.

review.des: Sushi is great. Don't come in even a minute earlier before they open. They kept the door locked until 4:30. I had to knock for them to open the door at 4:30. There were 2 other couples standing outside waiting in the cold. Not something I would ever expect out of a high-end place.

I've been coming here for two years and all I can say is wow! I've had sushi all around the world and this is the top place I've ever been to. The food is amazing and the experience is top notch. I need to add though that while I'm sure the other servers are great, you will guarantee yourself an out of this world experience if you request Nam to be your waiter. This man is a culinary prophet. He puts the "ish" in fish. Do your self a favor and request to have Nam serve you. You won't be disappointed!

Excellent service and even better food. Sushi specials were the best.  Raw octopus and hamachi appetizers were excellent.  Fanciest chirashi bowl ever with edible flowers and its own shoyu. Special cream puff ice cream, black sesame seed custard with fresh figs was the best.  $350 meal (including drinks) but well worth it.

This was excellent!!! Ate at the Izakaya for the first day of restaurant week 2018, and it knocked my socks off.

First course:
- chicken karaage with shishito pepper mustard/green sauce - 5/5
-aburi buri - 5/5. I was worried this could be a tiny serving size, but it had four very substantial sashimi  pieces

Second course:
- uni spaghetti with squid -3.5/5. I would describe this as a tasty fancy version of buttered noodles with squid rings and one piece of uni on top.
- fish of the day (hamachi fish collar marinated for three days in miso): 6/5. If this is the fish of the day, get this!!!! I like to steer clear of hyperbole when it comes to food, but this was the best fish collar I have ever had

Dessert:
- ice cream sandwich - 4/5. Two flavors are offered and tried them both. We both preferred the brown sugar, but the matcha is good if you're looking for something less sweet (still sweet though)

In addition to the restaurant week menu, we ordered a few rolls/sushi pieces from the Momotaro menu (which is awesome they let you do that). These were excellent as well! Highly recommend this place - will return.
Food was terrible, the sushi it's too sour, rice flavorless,  and mean it's hard to read, I won't back again.

Highly recommended for vegetarians/vegans! We had a delicious dinner at Momotaro and were thoroughly impressed. They have a separate menu just for vegetarians (with vegan items and items able to be made vegan) and everything we ordered was great. The momotaro tartare, maitake don buri, shiitake maki rolls, and age dashi tofu (house made tofu) specifically were all our favorites. We ended the meal with their sesame cake with salted caramel and it was equally tasty!

Came with a friend and we shared 2 rolls, a wagyu beef dish, and desert.

Tea selections are only on the dessert menu so keep that in mind if you want to order tea during dinner. I wish I had known this before I got stuck with plain old green tea. The tea was freshly brewed from leaves in front of me though which is always a plus.

There were 6 options of rolls (6 pieces each) and the two that we chose were very salty and didn't require soy sauce. We enjoyed them but I wish there was more than 1 salmon option.

The wagyu beef Don Buri was my favorite dish of our order and enough for sharing for 2-3 people as a side.

The mochi dessert was good but wasn't traditional mochi. It's made in house and has a gel wrap instead of the usual rice flour powdered wrap.

Overall the food was good but I am unlikely to return as the sushi didn't impress me that much for the price compared to other upscale sushi restaurants.

Nice place to treat youself. Like the kushiyaki mono, grilled king crab grill, hotate and daily special nigiri. Waited a little while for mentaiko
spaghetti and received  a service with the momotaro crunch which was really lovely and enjouyable.

So this restaurant is one of the best I've experienced in Chicago. If you are coming here and you like sushi, order the Nigiri with garnishes! All the fish was delicious (our favorites were the salmon, scallop, and I think red snapper. But really every piece of fish was FANTASTIC.)  The garnishes are unique and add so much fun and flavor to the dish, too.

Spaghetti was good too.  It's creamy but not too heavy, but it's just regular pasta with a unique sauce.

Seaweed salad was delicious and affordable.

Would not order the hirame appetizer again ($20 for five thin slices of fish with not much creativity in the dish besides it sitting on a tub of ice.  Nigiri or sashimi is a better and tastier deal any day.)

Service is lovely, and ambience is intimate.  A bit dark for good food photographs. Tables are a little close together, but nothing too distracting.
